item.title: 亚洲股市在美国股市上涨和中国股市支撑后将上涨：市场综述
item.description: 在美国股市因企业盈利强劲而创下新纪录，以及中国采取措施支撑房地产市场之后，亚洲股市早盘将攀升。【原文：Asian stocks are set to climb in early trading after US equities notched a fresh record amid resilient corporate earnings and China took steps to shore up its property market.】

item.title: 分析师称中国住房救助规模太小，不足以结束危机
item.description: 中国最新的住房措施针对的是空置房，这是这场持续了近三年的危机的一个主要痛点。但分析人士认为，这一揽子措施的力度仍然太小，不足以结束颓势。【原文：China’s latest housing initiative is aimed at vacant properties, a major pain point in a crisis that’s dragged on for almost three years. But the package of measures is still too small to end the rout, analysts say.】

item.title: 华尔街交易提速令全球金融岌岌可危
item.description:
各行各业的公司都在为即将到来的更快美股交割及其可能带来的问题做准备。【原文：

Firms of all stripes are preparing for the imminent shift to faster US stock settlement — and the issues it may bring.

】

item.title: 本周全球商品市场值得关注的五大图表
item.description: 从白银和黄金到天然气和橙汁，大宗商品正一路高歌猛进。与此同时，铜市在纽约遭遇空头挤压后陷入动荡。中东冲突继续扰乱液化天然气的流通，同时推高了运输成本。【原文：From silver and gold to natural gas and orange juice, commodities are on a tear — with a gauge of major raw materials showing a steady march upwards. Meanwhile, copper markets are in upheaval following a short squeeze in New York. And Middle East conflicts continue to disrupt the flows of liquefied natural gas while driving up shipping costs.】

item.title: 米莱伊访问极右翼集会引发西班牙严厉抨击
item.description: 西班牙社会党政府要求阿根廷总统哈维尔-米莱道歉，称这位自由主义领导人在马德里极右翼集会上的言论严重损害了两国关系。【原文：Spain’s socialist government demanded an apology from Argentine President Javier Milei, saying the libertarian leader’s comments at a far-right rally in Madrid had badly damaged relations.】

item.title: 美联储鲍威尔敦促法律专业毕业生 "超越自我 "思考问题
item.description: 周日，美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔在母校乔治城大学法律中心向新近毕业的大学生们宣传公共服务。【原文：Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell made a pitch for public service to recently minted graduates at Georgetown University Law Center, his alma mater, on Sunday.】

item.title: 伊拉克领导人称库尔德斯坦石油重启谈判陷入僵局
item.description: 伊拉克总理穆罕默德-希亚-苏达尼在一次电视新闻发布会上说，国际石油公司恢复从伊拉克库尔德斯坦地区出口原油的长期谈判没有取得任何进展。【原文：No progress has been made in long-standing talks for international oil companies to resume exporting crude from the Kurdistan region of Iraq, Prime Minister Mohammed Shia Al-Sudani said in a televised news conference.】

item.title: 建立在通胀欣喜之上的债券反弹面临英国的现实检验
item.description: 有迹象表明，全球最大经济体的通胀终于开始放缓，这点燃了全球债券涨势，但本周这一涨势再次面临现实的考验。【原文：A global bond rally ignited by signs that inflation in the world’s largest economy is finally slowing once again faces a reality check this week.】

item.title: 新西兰央行利率决议助推新西兰元看涨势头
item.description: 由于对通胀高企的担忧抑制了今年降息的预期，新西兰元有望延续近期涨势，并向 3 月份的高点反弹。【原文：New Zealand’s dollar is poised to extend recent gains and rally toward its March high as concern over elevated inflation damps expectations for interest-rate cuts this year.】

item.title: 比特币开发者将 "可编程性 "视为下一波涨势的催化剂
item.description: 今年 1 月，美国推出了期待已久的比特币交易所交易基金，上个月又进行了四年一次的 "减半 "软件更新，在此之后，许多加密货币投资者都在思考一个大问题：最大的加密货币下一次反弹的动力是什么？【原文：After the long-anticipated launch of US Bitcoin exchange-traded funds in January, and the once-every-four-years software update called the “halving” last month, the big question on a lot of crypto investors’ minds has been, what will power the largest cryptocurrency’s next rally?】

item.title: 巴尔的摩失事船只将于周一移至附近码头
item.description: 周日，18 个小时的准备工作开始，将摧毁巴尔的摩弗朗西斯-斯科特-基大桥的船只重新浮出水面，并将其移至附近的码头。【原文：Eighteen hours of preparations start Sunday to refloat the ship that destroyed Baltimore’s Francis Scott Key Bridge and move it to a nearby dock, as officials continue clearing the channel of wreckage that’s blocked the city’s port for almost two months.】

item.title: 南非在大选前掀起投资热潮
item.description: 几十年来最关键的南非大选已经在扭转该国金融市场的走势。【原文：The most pivotal South African election in decades is already turning the tide of the country’s financial markets.】

item.title: 亲商领袖阿比纳代尔在多米尼加人投票时寻求连任
item.description: 多米尼加共和国已经开始投票，亲商总统路易斯-阿比纳代尔将在美洲最强劲的经济体之一的背景下寻求第二个四年任期。【原文：Voting has started in the Dominican Republic as pro-business President Luis Abinader seeks a second four-year term on the back of one of the strongest economies in the Americas.】

item.title: 无人机袭击后俄罗斯南部炼油厂停工
item.description: 周日，大量乌克兰无人机袭击了俄罗斯南部，迫使克拉斯诺达尔的一家小型独立炼油厂停止运营。【原文：A flurry of Ukrainian drones attacked southern Russia on Sunday, forcing a small independent refinery in Krasnodar to halt operations.】

item.title: AFR 称跨骏将出售澳大利亚糖果商 Darrell Lea
item.description: 据《澳大利亚金融评论报》周日援引未具名消息人士的话报道，跨骏私募股权公司（Quadrant Private Equity）正准备在今年下半年出售澳大利亚巧克力和甘草生产商 Darrell Lea。【原文：Quadrant Private Equity is preparing a sale of Australian chocolate and liquorice maker Darrell Lea in the second half of this year, the Australian Financial Review reported Sunday, citing unidentified sources.】

item.title: 大多数泰国人支持首相将大麻重新归类为毒品的计划：调查
item.description: 一项调查显示，大多数泰国人支持总理萨维信（Srettha Thavisin）将大麻重新归类为麻醉品并限制其医疗用途的计划。【原文：The majority of Thais support Prime Minister Srettha Thavisin’s plan to reclassify cannabis as a narcotic and limit its use to medical purposes, according to a survey.】

item.title: 股票交易者应对美国对华新关税指南
item.description: 从半导体到太阳能电池板，世界上一些增长最快的行业的股票有可能成为中美新一轮贸易紧张局势的牺牲品。【原文：From semiconductors to solar panels, stocks in some of the world’s fastest-growing industries risk falling prey to another round of trade tensions between the US and China.】

item.title: 委内瑞拉马杜罗下令向公司征收 9% 的养老基金税
item.description: 委内瑞拉总统尼古拉斯-马杜罗颁布法令，规定对私营企业征收 9% 的税，用于建立国营养老基金。【原文：Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro issued a decree setting a 9% tax on private companies for the creation of a state-run pension fund.】

item.title: 墨西哥在热浪中宣布电网进入警戒状态
item.description: 墨西哥电网运营商 Cenace 周六宣布进入运行警戒状态，表明系统可用电力低于充足水平。【原文：Mexico’s power grid operator Cenace declared an operational state of alert on Saturday, indicating the system’s available power is lagging below adequate levels.】

item.title: 反叛的 Gildan 高管推动董事会换届和前首席执行官查曼迪回归
item.description: 服装制造商 Gildan Activewear Inc. 的一些高管正敦促投资者支持一位激进股东，该股东正试图赢得董事会控制权，并恢复被解雇的首席执行官格伦-查曼迪（Glenn Chamandy）的职务。【原文：Some executives of clothing maker Gildan Activewear Inc. are urging investors to support an activist shareholder that’s trying to win control of the board and reinstate fired Chief Executive Officer Glenn Chamandy.】

item.title: 通胀放缓为七国集团央行 6 月份的工作奠定基础
item.description: 就在各国央行行长在意大利开会讨论世界经济状况之际，七国集团发布的与通胀相关的数据将为各国央行行长做出至关重要的 6 月利率决定奠定基础。【原文：Inflation-related releases across the Group of Seven will prime central bankers for crucial June interest-rate decisions, just as they meet in Italy to discuss the state of the world economy.】

item.title: 大型基金押注 "除债券外一切皆有可能 "的交易即将结束
item.description: 大型美国债券投资者一直在积极地将资金转移到长期票据上，押注这一不受青睐的资产类别将成为最终降息的赢家之一。【原文：Big US bond investors have been aggressively shifting money into long-dated notes, betting that the unloved asset class will be one of the winners from eventual interest rate cuts.】

item.title: 昙花一现的 "备忘录 "瞬间让一些股票交易者狂喜不已
item.description: 备忘录股票的复兴几乎在开始的同时就结束了。【原文：The meme-stock revival was over almost as quickly as it began.】

item.title: 津巴布韦将从厄尔尼诺影响非洲国家的 6000 万美元赔款中获得一半以上的资金
item.description: 厄尔尼诺现象引发的干旱已经导致玉米减产，并导致非洲国家宣布进入灾难状态，津巴布韦将从预计为非洲四国提供的 6000 万美元保险赔款中获得一半以上的赔偿。【原文：Zimbabwe will get over half of an expected $60 million insurance pay out meant for four African nations as it reels from the impact of El Niño-induced drought that’s already slashed corn output and led to a state of disaster being declared.】

item.title: 贷款期限临近，国际米兰老板抨击债权人橡树公司
item.description: 国际米兰的所有者称，其债权人橡树资本管理公司（Oaktree Capital Management）缺乏 "有意义的参与"，无法为这家意大利足球俱乐部迫在眉睫的债务问题找到解决方案。【原文：Inter Milan’s owner says its creditor Oaktree Capital Management has lacked “meaningful engagement” to find a solution for the Italian football club’s looming debt obligations.】

item.title: 津巴布韦 FBC 控股公司收购渣打银行部门
item.description: 津巴布韦 FBC 控股有限公司已完成对渣打银行在南部非洲国家业务的收购。【原文：Zimbabwe’s FBC Holdings Ltd. has completed the acquisition of Standard Chartered Plc’s business in the southern African country.】

item.title: 从东京到纽约，全球股市屡创新高
item.description: 从纽约到伦敦再到东京，如果说全球股市有什么相似之处的话，那就是：屡创新高。【原文：From New York to London to Tokyo, if there’s one similarity among the world’s equity markets it’s this: record highs.】

item.title: S&P利润回升得益于大型科技公司和强劲的消费者需求
item.description: 现在，美国企业的财报季已经接近尾声，但从中可以看出：许多公司都表示，去年最严重的利润困境已经过去。【原文：Now that Corporate America’s earnings season is drawing to a close, the takeaway is clear: A broad swath of companies say the worst of last year’s profit pain is over.】

item.title: 里克-里德尔对通货膨胀和美联储加息的反向观点
item.description:
他说，随着富裕的美国人获得更高的收益率，2%的目标看起来更加艰难

。【原文：

That 2% target looks tougher as affluent Americans reap higher yields, he says

】

item.title: 盎格鲁收购传奇耗时已久，必和必拓就改进出价展开辩论
item.description: 必和必拓集团（BHP Group）以 430 亿美元收购英美资源集团（Anglo American Plc）的时间已经不多了，它面临着一个关键问题：如何才能在未来几天内将这家较小的公司吸引到谈判桌前？【原文：With time running out on its $43 billion pursuit of Anglo American Plc, BHP Group faces a critical question: what would it take to draw the smaller company to the negotiating table within the next few days?】
